Package asm

Class Tracer

java.lang.Object
asm.Tracer
public class Tracer extends Object
Stores information about the status of file processing (e.g. line and token number). When errors occur, they can be registered with an object of this class using the addError method.

Error messages will be formatted richly with the line number, line, and token number that caused the error.

An example error output might look like: 

 
     17: too many arguments for instruction
         mul r1 r2 r3 r4
                      ^
     1 error

The above error is read as: a "too many arguments" error occured at the fifth token ("r4") on the 17th line of the input file.

      public static final int MAX_ERRORS
      The maximum number of errors that will be stored at once.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tracer

      public Tracer()
      Constructs a new Tracer object.

  • Method Details

    • setLine

      public void setLine(String line)
      Updates the current line being processed by the assembler/disassembler.

      Calling this method resets the token number to zero.

      Parameters:
      line - the line currently being processed.

    • setLineNum

      public void setLineNum(int lineNum)
      Updates the current line number being processed.
      Parameters:
      lineNum - the line number being processed.

    • incrementToken

      public void incrementToken()
      Increments the token number being processed.

    • hasNewErrors

      public boolean hasNewErrors()
      Returns whether this tracer object has new error messages since the last time this method was called. Upon each call, the hasErrors flag is set to false, although the number of total errors can be viewed at any time by calling getNumErrors.
      Returns:
      whether new errors have been added since the last call to this method.
      See Also:
      • getNumErrors()

    • getNumErrors

      public int getNumErrors()
      Returns the total number of errors seen by this tracer.

      The number of errors returned by this method may exceed Tracer.MAX_ERRORS and may be larger than the number of error messages stored (that is, not all errors added will be kept as messages, but will still be acknowledged by an increment in numErrors).

      Returns:
      the total number of errors seen by this tracer.

    • addError

      public void addError(String message)
      Adds an error message to this tracer.

      The message will only be stored if getNumErrors < Tracer.MAX_ERRORS.

      Each message will have information about the erroring line and token appended to the provided error description. This line information is taken from the current state of the line/token instance variables of this class, which can be incremented with setLine, setLineNum, and incrementToken.

      Parameters:
      message - a message describing the error.

    • dumpErrors

      public void dumpErrors()
      Prints all errors kept by this trace (up to Tracer.MAX_ERRORS errors). Errors are printed to stderr.

    • clearErrors

      public void clearErrors()
      Clears all error information from this tracer. After a call to this method, getNumErrors will return zero, hasNewErrors will return false, and dumpErrors will not print anything to stderr.
